Night Shift grins.

" Right with ya Kup.  I've been waitn' for this day for=
 a looong time.  Hydras will think twice before he messes with us again. No=
w, I think our best bet, will be ta go off road, like Tucson says.  I know =
there's a river bed along the route, we keep ta that, we make no dust, and =
we leave no scent.  The water isn't too deep, so we got a shot at gettn' a =
good distance without gettn' our engines flooded."

Straight Shot nodds.

"=
Sounds like the best way ta go.  But keep in mind Night Shift, don't get to=
o ahead of us okay?"

Night Shift flashes a headlight.

"No sweat, I promis=
e, I won't get too far ahead.  I'm not much inta go'n too fast anyway.  The=
 faster tires roll, the more dirt we kick up.  Like Tucson says, slow, stea=
dy and silent.  Best way ta get the job done.  And hopefully we'll catch up=
 ta Cheetor."

As Rat Trap begins the next phase of the operation, he secur=
es himself in Windlord's talons, looking around as well as straight ahead, =
to their destination.

"Hmm, so far so good Windlord... But I can't help th=
inkn' that this could be too good ta be true..  Ya never know when a Pred's=
 gonna come outa nowhere for an unexpected ambush.  I'll keep my ears'n nos=
e peeled for trouble."

Tucson acknowledges Perceptor's reply.

" I copy th=
at Perceptor.  You're doing the best you can, and that is all I expect from=
 you.  If things do not work out for some reason, do not blame yourself for=
 something you can not control.  This was all brought about by Hydras, and =
I promise you he will pay the price for his torments."

He slowly moves int=
o position, rolling on silent tires.

" I'm going to start moving in slowly=
, behind Rat Trap, Windlord, Kup and Night Shift.  I have a feeling they wi=
ll need reinforcements.  Lord Elder, I need you to begin guiding me along t=
he river bed trail. Like the others, going off road is our best chance of g=
oing unseen and unheard.  But be careful, if you drive me into dense vegita=
tion I will stirr up the brush and that will look suspcious.  Best bet is t=
o keep along the area of the river bed, where vegitation is sparce."

Back =
at the Ark, Quickstride keeps his eyes, ears, and nose peeled for pending d=
anger.  He takes in the air with deep nostrills, yet appearing to be doing =
what horses normally do, just simply grazing on the grasses, while keeping =
an eye out for what's all around him.

" So far so good Rodimus, but ta me,=
 things look a little too quiet.. You would've thought by now someone would=
 catch onto something..  Maybe the plan is working but losing Cheetor's sig=
nal so early in the game, that's a little troubling... "

He lifts his head=
 up while looking around.
